1000+ Fulani herdsmen attack and burn Miza location, outside Lokoja. Causalities not known.

The GCSE teaching union went on strike to demand compliance by the government with their agreements.

A man who allegedly stole R35 at a tavern is killed by a group of residents when he went to apologise for the deed.
Villagers protest against poor service delivery and block the N2 road with debris and stone cars. The demonstrators were dispersed by police with rubber bullets.
The police apprehend and beat a prominent member of a local vigilante group. The arrested man later dies in police custody.
Two suspected witches are killed.
A group of vigilantes, along with an off-duty policeman, kill a local resident suspected of stealing car parts.

Pensioners protest about an infestation of rats in their dwelling and threaten to hold a local councilor hostage if the local authorities do not address the problem. No violence or police involvement reported.
100 Uitenhage residents march to Port Elizabeth's City Hall and demand answers to their earlier calls for a separate sub-council that would focus on the needs of those in both Uitenhage and Despatch.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
properties.NOTES: About 700 workers, affiliated to the National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa, peacefully strike over a number of work-related grievances including underpayment, the violation of previously agreed agreements and the use of non-local labour.
Officers for Isidingo Security assault vagrants at the beach for begging, resulting in the death of a homeless man.
Rioters pelt motorists with stones during a service delivery protest. Police are called in to disperse the demonstrators.
Residents of Malamulele strike and refuse to go to work. The protesters are demanding their own municipality.

Residents of Mvutshini near Eshowe blocked a road with burning tyres in an apparent service delivery protest .
A group of men kill three individuals accused of witchcraft.

Two security guards of Mandela Bay ward councillor Xola Sabani' are shot by unidentified individuals. Sabani had received death threats, allegedly from residents upset over the allocation of houses in the area. Both victims survive.
Members of the National Union of Mineworkers down tools and demand that CEO Paul Dunne and four other key managers be removed.
A thousand angry residents clash with police who are guarding individuals suspected of killing a 14-year-old resident. The police fight back the group with stun grenades and rubber bullets.
Residents of Mahwelereng township staged a protest in Mokopane demanding the delivery of water and electricity.
100 angry villagers protested in Mount Ayliff against bail for six men accused of killing a 34-year-old initiate.
Striking miners damage mine property at Northam Platinum's Zondereinde mine in Limpopo.

The SAF, assisted by the RSF, shelled Angartu, near Kadugli, between Jan.6-8.
Cooking gas distributors protested over the launch of direct sales centres of cooking gas in the town.
10 people were killed and other injured in an attack by a large group of government militiamen in more than 60 vehicles and on camelback on Birdik, in Kutum locality. They then pillaged the village.
12 RSF militiamen assaulted and raped 4 women, leaving them seriously injured.

The RSF and other government militias stormed villages in the area north of Tabit. At least 1 person was killed and all the belonging of the villagers were stolen.
Several villagers in Konjara, in Tawila locality, were wounded by militiamen who beat them with whips.
6 people were injured, 2 seriously, in a clash between gunmen who stole livestock and herders who attempted to retrieve them.
31 SLM-MM fighters, including the groups general commander of operations, were killed in an ambush by SAF soldiers in the Orshy area of North Darfur state.

5 people from the Misseriya tribe were killed and 3 others injured in clashes with the Rizeigat tribe between Jan.13-14 in El Jaraf area, southwest of El Meiram town. The fighting was the continuation of a feud begun last week between the two tribes.

3 villagers were killed in attacks on villages near Al Fasher by RSF militiamen. A number of people were wounded, 10 were abducted, and large numbers of livestock were also stolen.
RSF troops in 7 land cruisers attacked Zamzam camp and pillaged it. They also attacked villages nearby the camp, killing 2 people and stealing livestock and the belongings of the villagers.

5 people from the Misseriya tribe were killed and 3 others injured in clashes with the Rizeigat tribe between Jan.13-14 in El Jaraf area, southwest of El Meiram town. The fighting was the continuation of a feud begun last week between the two tribes.

RSF militiamen, supported by local militiamen on camels and horses, plundered the villages of Konjara North, Konjara South, Karfola and Jabayin, northeast of Tabit attacking villagers and forcing them to flee.
Pro-government militiamen attacked newly displaced people at the Argo camp for IDPs, and stole their livestock at gunpoint.
RSF militiamen carried out raids on villages in the Umm Baru locality, forcing villagers to flee into the wilderness.
3 villagers were "executed by a firing squad" of RSF militiamen in East Jebel Marra (Tawila). Thousands of displaced were also recorded leaving the area.

7 herders and 15 RSF members were killed in a gunfight following an RSF cattle theft. 5 herders also sustained injuries. Reinforcements came for the RSF, which then repulsed the herders and forced them to leave the livestock behind.

The SPLM-N has claimed they have taken control of Ankarto, near Kadugli, and Um Turq-Turq, north of Talodi. They also claim to have caused casualties (coded as 10 across the two locations) and seized large quantities of weapons.

properties.EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
properties.NOTES: Over the past two weeks, "border guards" have come through the villages around Zalingei, recruiting "civilians" and especially the sons of nomadic shepherds, to fight against rebels in East Jebel Marra.
Police blocked protesters organized by religious groups who attempted to march on the French embassy to demand an apology for the Charlie Hebdo cartoon featuring the Prophet Mohammad.
Hundreds of citizens of Wau have protested against the conflict in the country, demanding peace.
3 police officers in Songea injured by something believed to be a homemade bomb thrown at Matarawe area.

properties.EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
properties.NOTES: Military forces controlled the detonation of a bomb close to the Tanzania Broadcasting Corporation at Mshangano area in Songea.

Mohammed Ayub was lynched by a mob on Jan. 1 in Kinondoni District, for allegedly robbing people the previous day. His death sparked riots and violence by the Panya Road Gang on Jan. 2 in Dar es Salaam.
6 children injured after playing with and detonating a grenade near a dump site in Mbinga.
Residents of Tegeta Boko demonstrated against being charged for water despite having poor water service.

Supporters of Civic United Front protested election results during a swearing in ceremony at the Landmark Hotel in Kinondoni.  CCM winners Juma Mbena and Suleman Jeta were injured. Police used tear gas to disperse the protesters.

Tanzania Zambia Railway Authority (TAZARA) workers began a strike in both Tanzania and Zambia.  Work in both countries resumed on Jan. 16 following the High Court of Tanzania's Labor Division's ruling declaring the strike unlawful.
University of Dodoma students marched on campus at dawn on Jan. 14, demanding disbursement of meal funds. 84 students were held for questioning; ring leaders arrested.
5 people were injured after a hand grenade exploded inside a cinema hall in Amboni, on the outskirts of Tanga.
Dozens of reporters gathered at the French Embassy in Lom� to protest against terrorist attacks that took place at Charlie Hebdo magazine in Paris.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: SGEB: General Union of Primary Education
properties.NOTES: The General Union of Primary Education and the Union of Primary Education Inspectors staged a sit-in on Friday in front of the Parliament to protest against the decision to introduce a final exam and English and French classes in primary school.
Suspected Islamist extremists slit the throat of a Tunisian policeman in Zaghouan province overnight, the interior ministry said on Sunday.

A group of youth from the town of Redeyef, on Monday night, torched the local police station located in the city centre, after�clashes�with security forces, eye-witnesses told TAP correspondent in Gafsa.

On Wednesday, the unions representing the police forces, the National Guard and the Civil Protection in Tozeur District have organised a sit-in in front of the National Guard HQ in Tozeur to demand enhanced protection measures against terrorist attacks.
A masked man attempted Thursday to stab a police officer in El Aouina, Tunis northern suburbs. The assailant is on the run, said spokesperson for the Interior Ministry Mohamed Ali Laroui.
A large march was organised the students of the faculty of engineering in Tunis to demand the cancellation of a policy concerning vocational training and higher education.
Members of the Tunisian civil society gathered in front of the Cathedral in Tunis to express their solidarity with the French magazine Charlie Hebdo.
Sit-ins were staged in Sfax and Monastir to express solidarity with the two Tunisian journalists allegedly executed by a Libyan group affiliated with the Islamic State.

Around 300 people gathered in Tunis for a demonstration of solidarity with the Charlie Hebdo magazine and two Tunisian journalists that a Libyan armed group associated with the Islamic State claimed to have executed.
A soldier in uniform was attacked, on Wednesday, with a sharp object by unknown persons. He was wounded in the neck at El Mourouj, in the suburbs of Tunis.
Dozens of families marched in the centre of Tunis on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of the revolution.

Family members of the people killed or wounded during the 2011 uprising interrupted President  Beji Caid Essebsi during a ceremony for the fourth anniversary of the revolution. The demonstrators lamented the lack of justice during the transition to democ

Journalists and civil society members gathered in fron the municipality of B�ja to express their solidarity with the two Tunisian journalists kidnapped in Libya. They also encouraged the government to engage in the liberation of the two.

properties.EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
properties.NOTES: Attackers suspected to have come from Amuru District invade the Adjumani area and burn more than 17 houses to ashes and loot 27 animals. The area is contested between residents of the two the communities.
Police break into a mosque and evict protesters who occupied the building in a demonstration against the mosque 's current clerical leadership.

Unidentified assailants attack Sheikh Haruna Jjemba. The assailants exchange fire with Jjemba's bodyguard before withdrawing. The attack comes in the aftermath of a string of attacks on notable Muslim figures. Official sources blame the ADF while other s

properties.EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
properties.NOTES: Military police surround the residence of ex-general Sejusa in a bid to arrest him. Sejusa recently returned after going into exile for allegedly revealing that Museveni is organising for his son to succeed him.

properties.EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
properties.NOTES: Rwandan genocide suspect Jean Paul Birindabagabo  is arrested and extridited to the ICC.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: NAU: National Association of the Unemployed
properties.NOTES: Activist youth group - National Association of the Unemployed - demonstrates in Kampala .

properties.SOURCE: International Freedom of Expression Exchange Clearing House (Toronto)
properties.NOTES: A journalist covering a demonstration by an activist youth group - National Association of the Unemployed - in Kampala is detained and severely beaten into a coma by the police.

properties.SOURCE: International Freedom of Expression Exchange Clearing House (Toronto)
properties.NOTES: Journalists march to Naguru police station to protest against the beating of a journalist by a member of the police forces. They are intercepted by police and dispersed with pepper spray.
Workers at the Itezhi Tezhi Hydro Plant went on strike to protest inflated union fees and stagnant wages.

properties.ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
properties.NOTES: UPND member Geoffrey Bwalya Mwamba and his supporters attacked PF supporters in Bululu ward in Kasama. Injuries reported.

properties.ALLY_ACT_1: UPND: United Party for National Development
properties.NOTES: Machete-wielding Patrotic Front cadres attacked a UPND campaign team holding a meeting in Shiwangandu on January 2. No injuries reported.

Residents of Chipata Township in Kitwe beat two fire brigade officers (leaving one with a fractured arm and the other with a fractured skull) after the officers failed to retrieve a body from the Kafue River.

3000 workers from the Kalumbila Mine (130 kms from Solwezi) went on strike over mine hospital's alleged failure to treat mine accident victim Greyan Taimo, as well as First Quantum Minerals failure to pay a funeral grant.

properties.ALLY_ACT_1: UPND: United Party for National Development
properties.NOTES: Patriotic Front supporters and UPND supporters clashed in Mongu on Jan. 6, leaving one member of UPND injured after being hit in the head with a plank.

properties.ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
properties.NOTES: UPND cadres in Kapiri Mposhi beat up a member of the Patriotic Front and slashed him with knives.

Tanzania Zambia Railway Authority (TAZARA) workers began a strike in both Tanzania and Zambia.  Work in both countries resumed on Jan. 16 following the High Court of Tanzania's Labor Division's ruling declaring the strike unlawful.

properties.ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
properties.NOTES: UPND cadres stopped a car with a Patriotic Front chitenge (sarong) on the dashboard and beat up the two men inside. Assault occurred in  Monze on Jan. 12.

properties.ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
properties.NOTES: PF and UPND cadres clashed in Garden Compound in Lusaka. No injuries reported.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: UPND: United Party for National Development
properties.NOTES: UPND cadres burned a boat that was painted in Patriotic Front colors and kept near the Cross Road Shopping Mall in Lusaka.

properties.ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
properties.NOTES: UPND cadres attacked a man who was placing adverts at the Times of Zambia Rhodes Park Advertising Office in Lusaka.  They also smashed his vehicle.

properties.NOTES: Members of the Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) formation led by Morgan Tsvangirai and some belonging to the MDC Renewal Team clash at a funeral. The clash started when a member of the MDC-Renewal faction accused Tsvangirai of working with Mugabe.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
properties.NOTES: ZANU-PF youth invade farms belonging to party members supposedly aligned with ousted Vice-President Joice Mjuru. The youth protest that the current owners do not deserve the land due to their political affiliations.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: ZNLWVA: Zimbabwe National Liberation War Veterans Association; ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
properties.NOTES: More than 100 ZANU-PF and war veterans protestors staged a demonstration calling for the dismissal of senior staff at Mutawatawa District hospital.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
properties.NOTES: ZANU-PF youth invade farms belonging to party members supposedly aligned with ousted Vice-President Joice Mjuru. The youth protest that the current owners do not deserve the land due to their political affiliations.
Six villagers are hospitalised by police following a land ownership dispute involving Green Fuels Private Limited.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: ZISMIWU: Zimbabwe Sugar Milling Industry Workers' Union
properties.NOTES: About 1 000 cane workers demonstrate in the sugar-growing town of Chiredzi demanding the resignation of the secretary-general of Zimbabwe Sugar Milling Industry Workers' Union. The secretary-general is accused of not representing their interests as well

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
properties.NOTES: Police round up ZANU-PF supporters who invaded farms belonging to party members supposedly aligned with ousted Vice-President Joice Mjuru.

200  workers at Caps Holdings storm the company's headquarters in Harare and hold their management hostage demanding payment of their salaries which have reportedly remained unpaid for the past 20 months.
More than 200 villagers stage a demonstration at Masvingo Central Police Station against failure by Chiefs Musara and Chikwanda to resolve a boundary dispute. 8 of the demonstrators are arrested.

properties.ACTOR1: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
properties.ACTOR2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
properties.NOTES: A small group of MDC and ZANU-PF attack each other during a MDC youth mobilization and recruitment exercise resulting in serious injuries. MDC sources and government-run newspapers differ over who were the attackers and who were the victims.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front

Buhera South legislator Cde Joseph Chinotimba stages a one-man demonstration against City of Harare for arresting and impounding pirate taxis.

Five people die after their house is petrol bombed. The victims had been accused by a local man of practicising witchcraft.
Two police officers accused of corruption are beaten while in custody.

properties.ALLY_ACTOR: GRRA: Gweru Residents and Ratepayers Association
properties.NOTES: Gweru residents protest against the council's decision to hand them over to debt collectors over outstanding bills.
Starafrica Corporation's employees stage demonstration at the company's head office amid frustrations over unpaid salaries.

properties.NOTES: Hundreds of Zanu-PF supporters  demonstrate against their representative in the National Assembly Cde Didymus Mutasa, calling for his expulsion from the party for various indiscretions.
